meanings.definition: To remove ions from a solution.
meanings.sent1: I will deionize the water to make it pure.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a special machine to deionize the liquid.
meanings.sent3: After the experiment, the mad scientist tried to deionize the potion, but it turned into a rainbow instead!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to deionize the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's powers allowed him to deionize any harmful substances he encountered.

meanings.definition: To make a solution electrically neutral.
meanings.sent1: The technician will deionize the solution before conducting the experiment.
meanings.sent2: It is important to deionize the liquid to prevent any unwanted reactions.
meanings.sent3: The magician waved his wand and managed to deionize the potion, turning it into a harmless mist.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence seemed to deionize the charged atmosphere, bringing peace to the room.
meanings.sent5: The deionized water sparkled like diamonds under the sunlight, showing its purity.
